info.name: Mage Hunter
info.description: Mage Hunter (Fighter subclass) from LP Mills' Sealight
info.author: Sealight

description.p: While magic is common in Sealight, it is not universal To your average citizen, few things are more frightening than a maniac wielding a fireball, or a necromancer defiling graves and communing with the departed This is where the Monterosso Mage Hunter’s Guild comes in hailing from Blackrock, the Mage Hunters are a collective of wandering mercenaries who specialize in locating and neutralizing rogue spellcasters Viewing spellcasters as cowardly and unnatural, Mage Hunters memorize simple defensive spells that allow them to close in on their targets, disabling any active magic before plunging their weapons into the magician’s squishy, craven heart

td.em: Mage Hunter Spellcasting, Tricks of the Trade
Domain Spells, Total Recall, Psionic Potential

description.p: Beginning at 1st level, you know a variety of mnemonic devices to trigger your brain’s near mechanical precision. If you spend at least one minute performing a chant, ritual, or prayer, you may give yourself advantage on History, Arcana, and Perception checks for the next ten minutes. You may do this a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier.

description.p: Also at 1st level, your knowledge of the living mind allows you to unlock its hidden potential. As a bonus action, you may use the mind of one willing creature within 30 feet of you as your holy symbol, so long as the creature has an Intelligence score of 7 or higher. This creature becomes your Conduit, and as long as they are being used in this manner, you have access to the migraine cantrip. Additionally, you are able to communicate telepathically with your Conduit as a bonus action on your turns. This connection is broken if the Conduit is reduced to 0 Hit Points or moves more than 60 feet away from you. Once the connection is broken, you must spend a bonus action reestablishing it.

description.p: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to weaponize the minds of your allies. As an action, you access the mind your Conduit. For one minute, both you and your Conduit have advantage on all Wisdom and Charisma saving throws. Additionally, any hostile creature that begins its turn within 10 feet of either you or your Conduit must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 1d10 psychic damage.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, your enhanced psychic perception allows you to target and destroy specific parts of your foes’ ego. Before you make a spell attack that deals psychic damage, you can choose to take a -5 penalty to the attack roll If the attack hits, you add +10 to the attack’s damage. You can do this a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier. You regain all expended uses of this feature after a long rest.

description.p: By 8th level, your psionic powers are such that you emit a constant psychic ambience that can be uncomfortable to be near. When a creature within 10 feet of you has to make a Wisdom saving throw, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on it. You must use this feature before you know the outcome of the roll. Additionally, if the spell or effect that caused the Wisdom saving throw is created by a spell you cast, you can also choose to deal an additional 1d8 psychic damage to the target, immediately before the target makes its saving throw. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a long or short rest.

description.p: By 17th level, you have gained total control over both mind and body. You can now hover up to 20 feet above the ground, and have advantage on saving throws that would cause you to gain exhaustion on a failed save. Additionally, you are now able to maintain up to two Conduits at a time When you are connected to two Conduits, you gain the ability to cast migraine as a bonus action on your turn on any creature within range of one of your Conduits.
